post.description: Generates cost-optimized delivery schedules over multiple days (up to 7). Supports up to 1,000 visits per day and a time limit of 120 seconds for optimization.Supports combination of objectives via the `objective_costs` field. `ownership_type` determines whether vehicles appear in the API result always (`owned`) or only when used (`rented`).
post.summary: OMELET FSMVRP (fleet size and mix vrp) API for multiple days

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description:
Specifies the expected response media type and API version.
Must be "application/vnd.omelet.v2+json" to indicate version 2 of the OMELET Vehicle Routing API.

VersionedJSON.summary: Use v2 of OMELET JSON API

parameters.name: X-API-KEY
parameters.description: API Key

depots.description:
Depot details including location and name.
Each depot name within this list must be unique (no duplicates allowed).
Note: The `index` field in each Depot will be **ignored**.

index.description: Index of the depot in the distance matrix.
index.title: Depot Index

depots.title: Depot Information

daily_visits.description: List of multiple daily visit requests to be processed. Each item in the list specifies the visits to be made on a specific day by their names. Each day_id within this list must be unique (no duplicates allowed).The list must contain between 1 and 7 days (maximum one week).

day_id.description: Name or tag identifying the day (e.g., date string like '2025-05-01' or 'Day 1').
day_id.title: Daily Info

visits.description:
List of visit requests to be processed on this specific day. Must contain fewer than 1000 visits. Note: The `index` field in each Visit will be **ignored**.
Each visit name within this list must be unique (no duplicates allowed).

index.description: Index of the visit in the distance matrix.
index.title: Visit Index

service_time.description: Time (in minutes) to serve this visit.
service_time.title: Service Duration

volume.description: Volume of goods at the visit location (in cubic meters). Rounded to 3 decimal places.
volume.title: Visit Volume

weight.description: Weight of goods at the visit location (in kg). Rounded to 3 decimal places.
weight.title: Visit Weight

extra_demands.description: A list of additional capacity demands for this visit. Each value corresponds positionally to a vehicle's extra_capacities field. There are no explicit names for these capacity types — only the order matters. The list must be the same length as the vehicle's extra_capacities list. For example, if a vehicle has extra_capacities = [100, 200], and this visit has extra_demands = [5, 10], it means the visit uses 5 units of the first capacity and 10 units of the second. Decimal places will be ignored.
extra_demands.title: Extra Demands

unassigned_penalty.description: Penalty incurred if this visit cannot be assigned to any vehicle. This value is used to prioritize visits when the solver is unable to assign all visits.
unassigned_penalty.title: Unassigned Penalty

time_window.description: Permissible time range for service at this location, in ISO datetime format.
time_window.title: Visit Time Window

early_delivery_required.description: If true, this visit requires early delivery. The solver will attempt to schedule this visit so that its delivery completion time is earlier.
early_delivery_required.title: Requires Early Delivery

visits.title: Visits for the Day

delivery_start_time.description: ISO datetime for delivery start. Required if visits have time windows.
delivery_start_time.title: Start Time

daily_visits.title: Visits for the Days

vehicles.description:
Vehicles available for fsmvrp routing.
Each vehicle name within this list must be unique (no duplicates allowed).

volume_capacity.description: Maximum volume this vehicle can carry (in cubic meters). Rounded to 3 decimal places.
volume_capacity.title: Volume Capacity

weight_capacity.description: Maximum weight this vehicle can carry (in kg). Rounded to 3 decimal places.
weight_capacity.title: Weight Capacity

extra_capacities.description:
List of additional capacity types for this vehicle. Each value represents the maximum capacity for that type (e.g., temperature-controlled, hazardous materials). The order of these capacities must match the order of extra_demands in Visit.
For example, if a visit has extra_demands = [5, 10], and this vehicle has extra_capacities = [100, 200], it means the visit uses 5 units of the first capacity and 10 units of the second.
Decimal places will be ignored.
extra_capacities.title: Extra Capacities

work_start_time.description: Earliest datetime when the driver is available to begin their shift. This marks the lower bound of the driver's working hours.
work_start_time.title: Driver Shift Start Time

work_end_time.description: Latest datetime by which the driver must finish their shift. This marks the upper bound of the driver's working hours.
work_end_time.title: Driver Shift End Time

start_depot_name.description: Name of the depot where the vehicle begins its route. This should match the 'name' field of a defined Depot.
start_depot_name.title: Start Depot Name

end_depot_name.description: Name of the depot where the vehicle ends its route. This should match the 'name' field of a defined Depot.
end_depot_name.title: End Depot Name

fixed_cost_default.description: Fixed cost that always occurs, regardless of whether an order is assigned.
fixed_cost_default.title: Fixed Cost Default

fixed_cost_if_assigned.description: Fixed cost that occurs only when at least one order is assigned to the vehicle.
fixed_cost_if_assigned.title: Fixed Cost if Assigned

fuel_cost_per_km.description: Fuel cost in KRW per kilometer. Used to calculate fuel expenses for the route. For example, a value of 120.0 means the vehicle consumes 120 KRW per kilometer.
fuel_cost_per_km.title: Fuel Cost per km

visit_preference.description:
Optional dictionary assigning preference scores to visits.

- Keys: visit names (must match the 'name' field in Visit definitions)
- Values: integer scores representing preference
  - Higher → more preferred
  - 0 → neutral
  - Negative → avoid if possible

Example: { 'Visit A': 1, 'Visit B': 0, 'Visit C': -1 }
If no preference is specified for a visit, the default preference will be 0.
visit_preference.title: Visit Preferences

first_visit_costs.description:
Optional fixed cost incurred when a vehicle makes its first visits. The dictionary maps visit names to their costs in KRW.

Example:
{ 'Visit A': 3000, 'Visit B': 5000, 'Visit C': 7000 }
If no first visit cost is specified for a visit, the default cost will be 0.
first_visit_costs.title: First Visit Costs

consecutive_visit_tiered_costs.description:
Tiered distance-based cost rules.
Consists of (max_distance_meter, fixed_cost_krw) tuples.

If the travel distance between visits is less than or equal to max_distance_meter, the corresponding fixed_cost_krw is applied. Only the first matching rule is used.
To define a rule for all longer distances, use a very large number (e.g., 1e9) or infinity as the final max_distance.

Example:
[(5000, 3000), (1e9, 5000)] →
- Distance < 5,000m → 3,000 KRW
- Distance ≥ 5,000m → 5,000 KRW
If no consecutive visit tiered cost is specified for a visit, the default cost will be 0.
consecutive_visit_tiered_costs.title: Consecutive Visit Tiered Costs by Distance

vehicles.title: FSMVRP Vehicle List

objective_costs.description: List of cost types to be considered for the optimization.
objective_costs.title: Applicable Costs for Optimization

timelimit.description: Maximum time in seconds to run the optimization solver (1 to 120 seconds).
timelimit.title: Time Limit

routes.description: List of calculated vehicle routes based on the provided vehicles and visits.

vehicle_name.description: Name of the vehicle assigned to the route
vehicle_name.title: Name

route_indices.description:
List of depot and visit indices in the route. Depot indices refer to their positions in the combined list `[visits, depots]`. For example, if there are 5 visits and 2 depots, then:
- Visit indices range from 0 to 4
- Depot indices range from 5 to 6 (because depots are placed after visits)
route_indices.title: List of depot and visit indices

route_names.description: List of depot and visit names in the route
route_names.title: List of depot and visit names

arrival_times.description: List of arrival timestamps at each visit/depot in 'route_names'.
arrival_times.title: Arrival Times

departure_times.description: List of departure timestamps from each visit/depot in 'route_names'.
departure_times.title: Departure Times

routes.title: Optimized Routes

unassigned_visit_indices.description: List of visit indices that could not be assigned to any route. Indices correspond to positions in the original `visits` list (i.e., before adding depot visits).
unassigned_visit_indices.title: Unassigned Visit Indices

unassigned_visit_names.description: Names of visits that could not be assigned to any route.
unassigned_visit_names.title: Unassigned Visit Names

daily_total_solution_cost.description: Sum of all cost components for the day, including vehicle, fuel, and visit-related costs.
daily_total_solution_cost.title: Daily Total Solution Cost

daily_solution_cost_details.description: Cost totals per objective_cost calculated from the day's optimization results.
daily_solution_cost_details.title: Solution Cost Details

daily_results.description: A dictionary mapping each date to that day's optimization results.
daily_results.title: Daily Optimization Results

total_solution_cost.description: Overall total cost aggregated across all days and objective_costs.
total_solution_cost.title: Total Solution Cost

solution_cost_details.description: Total cost for each objective_cost, aggregated from all daily optimization results.
solution_cost_details.title: Aggregated Solution Cost

detail.description: Explanation of the result status for debugging or understanding the outcome.
detail.title: Status Description

post.description: Solves the pick-up and drop-off problem (PDP) to minimize total objective cost. Supports up to 500 visit pairs and a time limit of 120 seconds for optimization.
post.summary: OMELET PDP(pick up and drop off) API

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description:
Specifies the expected response media type and API version.
Must be "application/vnd.omelet.v2+json" to indicate version 2 of the OMELET Vehicle Routing API.

VersionedJSON.summary: Use v2 of OMELET JSON API

parameters.name: X-API-KEY
parameters.description: API Key

visits.description: List of pick-up and drop-off pairs to be handled. Maximum 500 pairs allowed.

index.description: Index of the visit in the distance matrix.
index.title: Visit Index

service_time.description: Time (in minutes) to serve this visit.
service_time.title: Service Duration

volume.description: Volume of goods at the visit location (in cubic meters). Rounded to 3 decimal places.
volume.title: Visit Volume

weight.description: Weight of goods at the visit location (in kg). Rounded to 3 decimal places.
weight.title: Visit Weight

extra_demands.description: A list of additional capacity demands for this visit. Each value corresponds positionally to a vehicle's extra_capacities field. There are no explicit names for these capacity types — only the order matters. The list must be the same length as the vehicle's extra_capacities list. For example, if a vehicle has extra_capacities = [100, 200], and this visit has extra_demands = [5, 10], it means the visit uses 5 units of the first capacity and 10 units of the second. Decimal places will be ignored.
extra_demands.title: Extra Demands

unassigned_penalty.description: Penalty incurred if this visit cannot be assigned to any vehicle. This value is used to prioritize visits when the solver is unable to assign all visits.
unassigned_penalty.title: Unassigned Penalty

time_window.description: Permissible time range for service at this location, in ISO datetime format.
time_window.title: Visit Time Window

early_delivery_required.description: If true, this visit requires early delivery. The solver will attempt to schedule this visit so that its delivery completion time is earlier.
early_delivery_required.title: Requires Early Delivery

index.description: Index of the visit in the distance matrix.
index.title: Visit Index

service_time.description: Time (in minutes) to serve this visit.
service_time.title: Service Duration

volume.description: Volume of goods at the visit location (in cubic meters). Rounded to 3 decimal places.
volume.title: Visit Volume

weight.description: Weight of goods at the visit location (in kg). Rounded to 3 decimal places.
weight.title: Visit Weight

extra_demands.description: A list of additional capacity demands for this visit. Each value corresponds positionally to a vehicle's extra_capacities field. There are no explicit names for these capacity types — only the order matters. The list must be the same length as the vehicle's extra_capacities list. For example, if a vehicle has extra_capacities = [100, 200], and this visit has extra_demands = [5, 10], it means the visit uses 5 units of the first capacity and 10 units of the second. Decimal places will be ignored.
extra_demands.title: Extra Demands

unassigned_penalty.description: Penalty incurred if this visit cannot be assigned to any vehicle. This value is used to prioritize visits when the solver is unable to assign all visits.
unassigned_penalty.title: Unassigned Penalty

time_window.description: Permissible time range for service at this location, in ISO datetime format.
time_window.title: Visit Time Window

early_delivery_required.description: If true, this visit requires early delivery. The solver will attempt to schedule this visit so that its delivery completion time is earlier.
early_delivery_required.title: Requires Early Delivery

visits.title: Pickup-Delivery Pairs

volume_capacity.description: Maximum volume this vehicle can carry (in cubic meters). Rounded to 3 decimal places.
volume_capacity.title: Volume Capacity

weight_capacity.description: Maximum weight this vehicle can carry (in kg). Rounded to 3 decimal places.
weight_capacity.title: Weight Capacity

extra_capacities.description:
List of additional capacity types for this vehicle. Each value represents the maximum capacity for that type (e.g., temperature-controlled, hazardous materials). The order of these capacities must match the order of extra_demands in Visit.
For example, if a visit has extra_demands = [5, 10], and this vehicle has extra_capacities = [100, 200], it means the visit uses 5 units of the first capacity and 10 units of the second.
Decimal places will be ignored.
extra_capacities.title: Extra Capacities

fixed_cost.description: Fixed cost incurred by using this vehicle.
fixed_cost.title: Fixed Cost

unit_distance_cost.description: Cost per unit of distance traveled.
unit_distance_cost.title: Unit Distance Cost

unit_duration_cost.description: Cost per unit of travel time.
unit_duration_cost.title: Unit Duration Cost

work_start_time.description: Earliest datetime when the driver is available to begin their shift. This marks the lower bound of the driver's working hours. Use ISO 8601 format with timezone, e.g., '2025-03-16T17:40:00+09:00'.
work_start_time.title: Driver Shift Start Time

work_end_time.description: Latest datetime by which the driver must finish their shift. This marks the upper bound of the driver's working hours. Use ISO 8601 format with timezone, e.g., '2025-03-16T17:40:00+09:00'.
work_end_time.title: Driver Shift End Time

visit_preference.description: Preference scores for each visit. Negative to avoid, higher values indicate stronger preference. Must match number of visits.
visit_preference.title: Visit Preferences

max_service_radius.description: Maximum radius (in meters) of the circumscribed circle containing all visits assigned to this vehicle. If specified, the solver will ensure that all visits assigned to this vehicle fit within a circle of this radius.
max_service_radius.title: Maximum Service Radius

pre_assigned_visits.description: List of visit names that are pre-assigned to this vehicle. If specified, the solver will ensure that these visits are assigned to this vehicle.
pre_assigned_visits.title: Pre-assigned Visits

max_round.description: Maximum number of rounds this vehicle can make in a schedule. A round is defined as a complete cycle starting and ending at the depot.
max_round.title: Maximum Rounds

distance_matrix.description: Matrix of distances between all locations. Optional if distances are auto-calculated.
distance_matrix.title: Distance Matrix

duration_matrix.description: Matrix of travel times between all locations. Optional if durations are auto-calculated.
duration_matrix.title: Duration Matrix

delivery_start_time.description: ISO datetime for delivery start. Required if visits have time windows.
delivery_start_time.title: Start Time

timelimit.description: Maximum time in seconds to run the optimization solver (1 to 120 seconds).
timelimit.title: Time Limit

allow_unassigned_visits.description:
If true, the solver may leave some visits unassigned if it cannot find a feasible solution. In this case, the status is feasible_with_unassigned_visits when unassigned visits exist.

If false, the solver will attempt to assign all visits, even if it means exceeding time limits.In this case, the status is infeasible when unassigned visits exist.
allow_unassigned_visits.title: Allow Unassigned Visits

use_large_size_optimization_algorithm.description: Enable advanced algorithm for better performance on large-scale problems.
use_large_size_optimization_algorithm.title: Use Large Problem Solver

include_departure_cost_from_depot.description: Whether to include the cost of departing from the depot when calculating the route cost.
include_departure_cost_from_depot.title: Include Departure Cost

include_return_cost_to_depot.description: Whether to include the cost of returning to the depot at the end of a route.
include_return_cost_to_depot.title: Include Return Cost

is_max_service_radius_hard_constraint.description: Whether to treat max service radius as a hard constraint.
is_max_service_radius_hard_constraint.title: Is Max Service Radius Hard Constraint

For example, if a visit has extra_demands = [5, 10], and this vehicle has extra_capacities = [100, 200], it means the visit uses 5 units of the first capacity and 10 units of the second.
Decimal places will be ignored.

fixed_cost_default.title: Fixed Cost Default

fixed_cost_if_assigned.description: Fixed cost that occurs only when at least one order is assigned to the vehicle.
fixed_cost_if_assigned.title: Fixed Cost if Assigned

fuel_cost_per_km.description: Fuel cost in KRW per kilometer. Used to calculate fuel expenses for the route. For example, a value of 120.0 means the vehicle consumes 120 KRW per kilometer.
fuel_cost_per_km.title: Fuel Cost per km

visit_preference.description:
Optional dictionary assigning preference scores to visits.

- Keys: visit names (must match the 'name' field in Visit definitions)
- Values: integer scores representing preference
  - Higher → more preferred
  - 0 → neutral
  - Negative → avoid if possible

Example: { 'Visit A': 1, 'Visit B': 0, 'Visit C': -1 }
If no preference is specified for a visit, the default preference will be 0.
visit_preference.title: Visit Preferences

first_visit_costs.description:
Optional fixed cost incurred when a vehicle makes its first visits. The dictionary maps visit names to their costs in KRW.

Example:
{ 'Visit A': 3000, 'Visit B': 5000, 'Visit C': 7000 }
If no first visit cost is specified for a visit, the default cost will be 0.
first_visit_costs.title: First Visit Costs

consecutive_visit_tiered_costs.description:
Tiered distance-based cost rules.
Consists of (max_distance_meter, fixed_cost_krw) tuples.

If the travel distance between visits is less than or equal to max_distance_meter, the corresponding fixed_cost_krw is applied. Only the first matching rule is used.
To define a rule for all longer distances, use a very large number (e.g., 1e9) or infinity as the final max_distance.

Example:
[(5000, 3000), (1e9, 5000)] →
- Distance < 5,000m → 3,000 KRW
- Distance ≥ 5,000m → 5,000 KRW
If no consecutive visit tiered cost is specified for a visit, the default cost will be 0.
consecutive_visit_tiered_costs.title: Consecutive Visit Tiered Costs by Distance

weight_capacity.description: Maximum weight this vehicle can carry (in kg). Rounded to 3 decimal places.
weight_capacity.title: Weight Capacity

extra_capacities.description:
List of additional capacity types for this vehicle. Each value represents the maximum capacity for that type (e.g., temperature-controlled, hazardous materials). The order of these capacities must match the order of extra_demands in Visit.
For example, if a visit has extra_demands = [5, 10], and this vehicle has extra_capacities = [100, 200], it means the visit uses 5 units of the first capacity and 10 units of the second.
Decimal places will be ignored.
extra_capacities.title: Extra Capacities

work_end_time.description: Latest datetime by which the driver must finish their shift. This marks the upper bound of the driver's working hours.

start_depot_name.description: Name of the depot where the vehicle begins its route. This should match the 'name' field of a defined Depot.
start_depot_name.title: Start Depot Name

end_depot_name.description: Name of the depot where the vehicle ends its route. This should match the 'name' field of a defined Depot.
end_depot_name.title: End Depot Name

fixed_cost_default.description: Fixed cost that always occurs, regardless of whether an order is assigned.
fixed_cost_default.title: Fixed Cost Default

fixed_cost_if_assigned.description: Fixed cost that occurs only when at least one order is assigned to the vehicle.
fixed_cost_if_assigned.title: Fixed Cost if Assigned

fuel_cost_per_km.description: Fuel cost in KRW per kilometer. Used to calculate fuel expenses for the route. For example, a value of 120.0 means the vehicle consumes 120 KRW per kilometer.
fuel_cost_per_km.title: Fuel Cost per km

visit_preference.description:
Optional dictionary assigning preference scores to visits.

- Keys: visit names (must match the 'name' field in Visit definitions)
- Values: integer scores representing preference
  - Higher → more preferred
  - 0 → neutral
  - Negative → avoid if possible

Example: { 'Visit A': 1, 'Visit B': 0, 'Visit C': -1 }
If no preference is specified for a visit, the default preference will be 0.
visit_preference.title: Visit Preferences

first_visit_costs.description:
Optional fixed cost incurred when a vehicle makes its first visits. The dictionary maps visit names to their costs in KRW.

Example:
{ 'Visit A': 3000, 'Visit B': 5000, 'Visit C': 7000 }
If no first visit cost is specified for a visit, the default cost will be 0.
first_visit_costs.title: First Visit Costs

consecutive_visit_tiered_costs.description:
Tiered distance-based cost rules.
Consists of (max_distance_meter, fixed_cost_krw) tuples.

If the travel distance between visits is less than or equal to max_distance_meter, the corresponding fixed_cost_krw is applied. Only the first matching rule is used.
To define a rule for all longer distances, use a very large number (e.g., 1e9) or infinity as the final max_distance.

Example:
[(5000, 3000), (1e9, 5000)] →
- Distance < 5,000m → 3,000 KRW
- Distance ≥ 5,000m → 5,000 KRW
If no consecutive visit tiered cost is specified for a visit, the default cost will be 0.
consecutive_visit_tiered_costs.title: Consecutive Visit Tiered Costs by Distance

If true, the solver may leave some visits unassigned if it cannot find a feasible solution. In this case, the status is feasible_with_unassigned_visits when unassigned visits exist.

If false, the solver will attempt to assign all visits, even if it means exceeding time limits.In this case, the status is infeasible when unassigned visits exist.

volume_capacity.description: Maximum volume this vehicle can carry (in cubic meters). Rounded to 3 decimal places.
volume_capacity.title: Volume Capacity

weight_capacity.description: Maximum weight this vehicle can carry (in kg). Rounded to 3 decimal places.
weight_capacity.title: Weight Capacity

extra_capacities.description:
List of additional capacity types for this vehicle. Each value represents the maximum capacity for that type (e.g., temperature-controlled, hazardous materials). The order of these capacities must match the order of extra_demands in Visit.
For example, if a visit has extra_demands = [5, 10], and this vehicle has extra_capacities = [100, 200], it means the visit uses 5 units of the first capacity and 10 units of the second.
Decimal places will be ignored.
extra_capacities.title: Extra Capacities

fixed_cost.description: Fixed cost incurred by using this vehicle.
fixed_cost.title: Fixed Cost

unit_distance_cost.description: Cost per unit of distance traveled.
unit_distance_cost.title: Unit Distance Cost

unit_duration_cost.description: Cost per unit of travel time.
unit_duration_cost.title: Unit Duration Cost

work_start_time.description: Earliest datetime when the driver is available to begin their shift. This marks the lower bound of the driver's working hours. Use ISO 8601 format with timezone, e.g., '2025-03-16T17:40:00+09:00'.
work_start_time.title: Driver Shift Start Time

work_end_time.description: Latest datetime by which the driver must finish their shift. This marks the upper bound of the driver's working hours. Use ISO 8601 format with timezone, e.g., '2025-03-16T17:40:00+09:00'.
work_end_time.title: Driver Shift End Time

visit_preference.description: Preference scores for each visit. Negative to avoid, higher values indicate stronger preference. Must match number of visits.
visit_preference.title: Visit Preferences

max_service_radius.description: Maximum radius (in meters) of the circumscribed circle containing all visits assigned to this vehicle. If specified, the solver will ensure that all visits assigned to this vehicle fit within a circle of this radius.
max_service_radius.title: Maximum Service Radius

pre_assigned_visits.description: List of visit names that are pre-assigned to this vehicle. If specified, the solver will ensure that these visits are assigned to this vehicle.
pre_assigned_visits.title: Pre-assigned Visits

max_round.description: Maximum number of rounds this vehicle can make in a schedule. A round is defined as a complete cycle starting and ending at the depot.
max_round.title: Maximum Rounds

index.description: Index of the visit in the distance matrix.
index.title: Visit Index

service_time.description: Time (in minutes) to serve this visit.
service_time.title: Service Duration

volume.description: Volume of goods at the visit location (in cubic meters). Rounded to 3 decimal places.
volume.title: Visit Volume

weight.description: Weight of goods at the visit location (in kg). Rounded to 3 decimal places.
weight.title: Visit Weight

extra_demands.description: A list of additional capacity demands for this visit. Each value corresponds positionally to a vehicle's extra_capacities field. There are no explicit names for these capacity types — only the order matters. The list must be the same length as the vehicle's extra_capacities list. For example, if a vehicle has extra_capacities = [100, 200], and this visit has extra_demands = [5, 10], it means the visit uses 5 units of the first capacity and 10 units of the second. Decimal places will be ignored.
extra_demands.title: Extra Demands

unassigned_penalty.description: Penalty incurred if this visit cannot be assigned to any vehicle. This value is used to prioritize visits when the solver is unable to assign all visits.
unassigned_penalty.title: Unassigned Penalty

time_window.description: Permissible time range for service at this location, in ISO datetime format.
time_window.title: Visit Time Window

early_delivery_required.description: If true, this visit requires early delivery. The solver will attempt to schedule this visit so that its delivery completion time is earlier.
early_delivery_required.title: Requires Early Delivery

allow_unassigned_visits.description:
If true, the solver may leave some visits unassigned if it cannot find a feasible solution. In this case, the status is feasible_with_unassigned_visits when unassigned visits exist.

If false, the solver will attempt to assign all visits, even if it means exceeding time limits.In this case, the status is infeasible when unassigned visits exist.
allow_unassigned_visits.title: Allow Unassigned Visits

use_large_size_optimization_algorithm.description: Enable advanced algorithm for better performance on large-scale problems.
use_large_size_optimization_algorithm.title: Use Large Problem Solver

include_departure_cost_from_depot.description: Whether to include the cost of departing from the depot when calculating the route cost.
include_departure_cost_from_depot.title: Include Departure Cost

include_return_cost_to_depot.description: Whether to include the cost of returning to the depot at the end of a route.
include_return_cost_to_depot.title: Include Return Cost

is_max_service_radius_hard_constraint.description: Whether to treat max service radius as a hard constraint.
is_max_service_radius_hard_constraint.title: Is Max Service Radius Hard Constraint
